{{Infobox national football team | Name = France | Flag = Flag of France.svg | Badge = | FIFA Trigramme = FRA | Nickname = Les Bleuets (The Little Blues)
''Les Tricolores'' (The Tri-colours) | Association = [[French Football Federation]] | Confederation = [[UEFA]] ([[Europe]]) | Coach = [[Philippe Bergeroo]] | Captain = ''TBD'' | Most caps = [[Willy Sagnol]]
[[LoÃ¯c Nego]] (15) | Top scorer = [[David Trezeguet]] (12) | pattern_la1 =_fra11h|pattern_ra1=_fra11h|pattern_b1=_fra11h | pattern_ra1 =_fra11h|pattern_so1=_fra11h|pattern_sh1=_fra11h | pattern_so1 =_fra11h| leftarm1=2225AA|body1=2225AA|rightarm1=2225AA|shorts1=FFFFFF | socks1 = FF0000 | pattern_la2 =_fra11a|pattern_b2=_fra11a|pattern_ra2=_fra11a | pattern_sh2 = |pattern_so2=| leftarm2=FFFFFF|body2=FFFFFF | rightarm2 = FFFFFF|shorts2=2225AA|socks2=FFFFFF }} The '''France national under-20 football team''' is the national under-20 football team of [[France]] and is controlled by the [[French Football Federation]]. The team competes in the [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]], which is held every two years and the [[Toulon Tournament]], which is held every May when [[League system#Football .28soccer.29|football league]] seasons have ended. The team usually participates in the latter tournament when the [[France national under-21 football team|under-21 team]] doesn't send a team. The under-20 team also participates in the quad-annual [[Mediterranean Games]] and [[Jeux de la Francophonie]] football tournaments. The under-20 team is often cited as a [[Farm team|feeder squad]] to the under-21 team as it rarely plays. In the FIFA U-20 World Cup, France have reached the quarter-finals of the competition on two occasions; in [[1997 FIFA World Youth Championship|1997]] and [[2001 FIFA World Youth Championship|2001]]. In the [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2011 edition of the competition]], the team reached the semi-finals for the first time in national team history. The current coach of the under-20 team is [[Philippe Bergeroo]], a former football player, notably for [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]], [[Lille OSC|Lille]], and [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]]. Prior to coaching for the French Football Federation, Bergeroo had domestic coaching tenures at [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] and [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]]. == Players == === Current squad === *The following players were called up to participate in two friendly matches against [[Israel national under-20 football team|Israel]] that will be played through 10â14 November 2011.{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/individus/selections/der_selection.php?id_selection=4 | title = Matches internationaux en IsraÃ«l U20 du lundi 07 novembre 2011 au lundi 14 novembre 2011 | date = 31 October 2011 | accessdate = 31 October 2011 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}} Two days after the squad was announced, defender [[Johan Martial]] and strikers [[Rachid Alioui]] and [[Anthony Derouard]] withdrew from the selection. They were replaced in the squad by defender [[Djibril SidibÃ© (footballer born 1992)|Djibril SidibÃ©]], [[midfielder]] [[Alexandre Coeff]], and striker [[Maxime Bourgeois]].{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/20ans/actualite/539843_maxime-bourgeois-et-alexandre-coeff-convoques | title = Maxime Bourgeois et Alexandre Coeff convoquÃ©s | date = 2 November 2011 | accessdate = 2 November 2011 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}} On 7 November, [[Enzo Reale]] and [[Willy Boly]] withdrew from the team. The two players spots were given to Alassane TambÃ© and [[Arnaud Souquet]].{{cite news | url=http://www.fff.fr/selections/20ans/actualite/539899_deux-nouveaux-changements-dans-la-liste | title = Deux nouveaux changements dans la liste | date = 7 November 2011 | accessdate = 7 November 2011 | publisher = [[French Football Federation]] | language = French}} ''Caps and goals are as current as the squad's previous match against Israel on 13 November 2011.
